identificationModule.officialTitle: Risk Factors Leading to the Formation of Intranasal Synechiae in Patients After Endonasal Surgery

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Analyze the factors influencing the development of intranasal adhesions (synechiae), with particular emphasis on the use of nasal septal separators, and to suggest a solution to reduce this complication in the future.

Analyze of the medical documentation. It was not an experimental examination.

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: Patients underwent septoconchoplasty with or without turbionplasty. Surgeons didn't use nasal splits.
interventionNames: Other: Cottle's septoplasty and radiocoagulation conchoplasty

armGroups.label: Study group
armGroups.description: Patients underwent septoconchoplasty with or without turbionplasty. Surgeons used nasal splits.
interventionNames: Other: Cottle's septoplasty and radiocoagulation conchoplasty

interventions.name: Cottle's septoplasty and radiocoagulation conchoplasty
interventions.description: Cottle's septoplasty and radiocoagulation conchoplasty Study group - added nasal splits; Control group - nasal splits weren't used.

primaryOutcomes.description: Intranasal synechiae after rhino nasal procedures

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* septo or septoconchoplasty

Exclusion Criteria:

* incompleted documentation
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients who were operated in Polish hospital (Gorzów Wlkp).

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Publication of results in open access magazine
